definitions.definition: In dire need (of something); having a dire need or desire.
examples: I hadn't eaten in two days and was desperate for food.
desperate to eat; desperate for attention

definitions.definition: Being filled with, or in a state of, despair ; hopeless .
examples: I was so desperate at one point, I even went to see a loan shark.

definitions.definition: Beyond hope, leaving little reason for hope; causing despair; extremely perilous.
Involving or employing extreme measures, without regard to danger or safety; reckless due to hopelessness.
examples: He dove into the rushing waters in a desperate effort to save her life.

main_definition: In dire need (of something); having a dire need or desire.
secondary_definitions: Being filled with, or in a state of, despair ; hopeless .
Beyond hope, leaving little reason for hope; causing despair; extremely perilous.
Involving or employing extreme measures, without regard to danger or safety; reckless due to hopelessness.
